message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with computational geometry and algorithmic problems related to computing a variant of the Fr\'{e}chet distance between two polygonal curves in the plane. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of approximation algorithms and the complexity of the decision problem, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of hardness results and exact algorithms indicates that it could be relevant to cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) as well. Finally, the study of distances and approximation algorithms suggests that it could be related to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics).
